publication.abstract: Genomic islands (clusters of genes of potential horizontal origin in a prokaryotic genome) are frequently associated with a particular adaptation of a microbe that is of medical, agricultural or environmental importance, such as antibiotic resistance, pathogen virulence, or metal resistance. While many sequence features associated with such islands have been adopted separately in applications for analysis of genomic islands, including pathogenicity islands, there is no single application that integrates multiple features for island detection. IslandPath is a network service which incorporates multiple DNA signals and genome annotation features into a graphical display of a bacterial or archaeal genome, to aid the detection of genomic islands.
publication.title: IslandPath: Aiding detection of genomic islands in prokaryotes

summary.description: This tool aids genomic island detection in prokaryotic genome seqeunces, using features such as dinucleotide bias, G+C, location of tRNA genes, annotations of mobility genes, etc. Genomic islands are defined here as genomic regions of potential horizontal origin.
summary.name: IslandPath
